t: To the chief Musician{H5329}{(H8764)}, A Psalm{H4210} of David{H1732}. How long wilt thou forget{H7911}{(H8799)} me, O LORD{H3068}? for ever{H5331}? how long wilt thou hide{H5641}{(H8686)} thy face{H6440} from me?

How long shall I take{H7896}{(H8799)} counsel{H6098} in my soul{H5315}, having sorrow{H3015} in my heart{H3824} daily{H3119}? how long shall mine enemy{H341}{(H8802)} be exalted{H7311}{(H8799)} over me?
Consider{H5027}{(H8685)} and hear{H6030}{(H8798)} me, O LORD{H3068} my God{H430}: lighten{H215}{(H8685)} mine eyes{H5869}, lest I sleep{H3462}{(H8799)} the sleep of death{H4194};
Lest mine enemy{H341}{(H8802)} say{H559}{(H8799)}, I have prevailed{H3201}{(H8804)} against him; and those that trouble{H6862} me rejoice{H1523}{(H8799)} when I am moved{H4131}{(H8735)}.
But I have trusted{H982}{(H8804)} in thy mercy{H2617}; my heart{H3820} shall rejoice{H1523}{(H8799)} in thy salvation{H3444}.
I will sing{H7891}{(H8799)} unto the LORD{H3068}, because he hath dealt bountifully{H1580}{(H8804)} with me.
